channel.title: Productivity on FalconBlog
channel.description: Recent content in Productivity on FalconBlog

item.title: Day 25
item.description:
📅 June 25, 2025 – Wednesday

  • 🧠 Codeforces Practice (8:30–9:30 AM): Solved 3 problems from the problemset to sharpen competitive programming skills.
  • 🤖 Built FalconBot (9:30–10 AM): Created my first Telegram bot, a mini utility tool – FalconBot.
  • 🍽️ Breakfast (10:00–10:30 AM): Took a quick recharge break.
  • 🔐 Google CTF – Crypto (10:30–12:30 PM): Solved the Blinders challenge from Google CTF 2024 – a fun and tricky crypto problem.
  • 🔑 OpenAI Router & API Keys (12:30–1:30 PM): Experimented with routing requests and managing API keys for future automation tools.
  • 🤝 Project Collaboration (1:30–2:30 PM): Helped teammates with their tasks and contributed to active modules.
  • 🍛 Lunch (2:30–3:00 PM): Refueled with lunch.
  • 🎓 NPTEL Lectures (3:00–5:00 PM): Studied selected NPTEL content to enhance foundational understanding.
  • 🍪 Snack Break (5:00–5:30 PM): Quick refreshment.
  • 🏥 Hospital Visit & Shopping (5:30–6:30 PM): Took care of essentials and quick shopping.
  • 😌 Loafing (6:30–8:00 PM): Took time to relax and mentally recharge.
  • 📞 Project Meet (8:00–10:30 PM): Long call with project lead; reviewed progress, restructured plans, and reassigned roles.

A jam-packed day blending tech, productivity, and self-care.

item.title: Day 22
item.description:
📅 June 22, 2025 – Sunday

  • Updated Profiles: Polished up my LinkedIn and GitHub profiles to reflect my latest work and activities.
  • Readme Revamp: Refreshed my GitHub README.md, making it more representative of my projects and contributions.
  • LaTeX Exploration: Spent time learning LaTeX, understanding the basics and experimenting with academic templates.
  • Academic Prep: Researched and gathered templates related to BTPs and UGRC to stay prepared for upcoming semesters.
  • C++ Practice: Dedicated 2 hours to improving C++ programming skills.

A well-rounded day spent organizing, learning, and prepping for future academic goals.

item.title: Day 12
item.description:
📅 June 12, 2025 – Thursday

  • Second CP Contest: Participated in another competitive programming contest to sharpen my problem-solving skills.
  • Drafted Team Meeting Agenda: Outlined the key discussion points for the upcoming team meeting to ensure smooth communication.
  • Configured Notion for Team Collaboration: Set up and organized the team’s Notion workspace with project docs, task lists, and resource links for seamless coordination.

item.title: Day 1
item.description:
📘 June 1, 2025 – Sunday

  • Revised Basic C: Revisited foundational concepts in C programming, reinforcing core syntax and logic building.
  • Documented on GitHub: Created or updated repositories with the day’s learning and notes, maintaining consistent documentation habits.
  • Organised Mails: Spent time cleaning up and sorting email inboxes for better productivity and clarity going forward.

item.title: The Power of Automation in Everyday Life
item.description:
Automation isn’t just a buzzword. It’s quietly revolutionizing the way we live, work, and interact with the world. From the moment you wake up to the time you hit the bed at night, automation is there, making everything smoother and more efficient. But what does this really mean for us as individuals?

What is Automation?

At its core, automation is the use of technology to perform tasks without human intervention. This can range from simple tasks, like setting alarms or automating your morning coffee, to more complex systems, such as self-driving cars or financial algorithms predicting stock market trends.
